description: The SportsInJSON schema contains properties common to all (or many) sports.

article.description: Holds either an article or a reference to an article. | Recommended format is NITF.

articleRef.description: URL or system identifier (or IDREF?) to an externally-located news article.

rating.description: A judged value placed on the team or individual. | Often used in British soccer.

ratingIssuer.description: The entity or organization which issued the rating.

ratingMaximum.description: The maximum value for the rating.

rank.description: How a team is doing in comparison to other teams or players. | May be qualified, so that one ranks teams or players according to, say, how they play at home, or within their division.

type.description: The type of the rank. Generally a publisher-specific controlled vocabulary.

issuer.description: The entity or organization which issued the rank.

penaltyStats.description: Statistics that detail the number of each type of penalty. | Can be recorded for either a team or a player.

type.description: Could be a numeric value like 2, 5 or 10 for ice hockey, or yellow-card or red-card for soccer etc.

count.description: The number of that type of penalities for this team or player.

value.description: Amount penalized. Eg. total minutes (ice-hockey, lacrosse, etc.) or yards (american-football).

outcomeTotal.description: A report on the number of wins, losses, etc., the team or player had during a particular time period. | Can also be scoped with various coverage qualifications, such as just events played at home.

undecideds.description: Number of events that were started, but ended up undecided.

winningPercentage.description: The winning percentage. Generally, wins divided by total events completed.

pointsScoredFor.description: The number of points a team has scored against its opponents during an extended time period.

pointsScoredAgainst.description: The number of points scored against a team by its opponents during an extended time period.

pointsDifference.description: The final calculated difference between points-scored-for and points-scored-against. Possibly takes into account other scoring aspects, such as penalties and differences in score-values.

standingPoints.description: A quantity used to rank teams, usually within a division, in order to decide who comes in first at the end of a season. Localized to the coverage-attributes.

standingPointsAgainst.description: Points counted against a team in rankings. Used in European handball standings, for example.

streakType.description: Whether this is a streak of wins, of losses, etc. SportsML vocabulary uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spstreaktype/

streakTotal.description: Holds the number of goals scored during a streak-type of score, for example.

streakStart.description: Date on which the streak began.

streakEnd.description: Date on which the streak ended.

eventsPlayed.description: Number of events played within the scope of play.

eventsRemaining.description: Number of events remaining within the scope of play.

gamesBack.description: A number used to measure how behind one team is from first place. The first place team is 0 games back.

lossesOvertime.description: Number of losses in events which went into overtime. For leagues that use this as a top-level outcome category (eg. NHL), as opposed to just a derivative of scoping.

outcomeResult.description: A report on the result, if any, from the event etc.

type.description: The type of outcome result. Can be things like relegation, promotion and qualification

key.description: A key for the type of result described

comment.description: Textual comment about the outcome result

genericStat.description: A generic stat element that can be used together with or instead of more specific stat element and attributes. With nested stats the lower levels should be regarded as having the same value as their parents if that attribute is not specifically set.

name.description: The name of the stat. SportsML names are same as attribute names of stats in the sport-specific plugins.

baseStats.description: The very basic stats type for persons and teams, Extended by base2stats and used directly by officalstats.

base2Stats.description: Second level stats. Extends baseStats. Extended further in base3stats and used directly in associate

points.description: Points accumulated by this associate. For example, points earned by a NASCAR owner.

base3Stats.description: Extends base2stats. Further extended in genericEntitystats. Used directly by groupStats

baseGenericEntityStats.description: Statistics that apply to a team as a whole or a player. | Not all stats are used in every sport.

eventsPlayed.description: The number of sports-events in which this team or player has already participated.

timePlayedTotal.description: Value for the amount of time played by the team or player over the course of a particular time-span, such as a season.

eventRecord.description: A world, national, state, or school record. | More than one record can be set by one participant at one sports-event.

previousRecord.description: The score value of the previously-held record.

subScore.description: Statistics that detail the score for a particular period or inning. Per-sport controlled vocabularies used for period- value.

periodValue.description: Generally a natural number. Could also be quarter-1, period-2, inning-5, etc.

score.description: The score for that period (or scoring unit).

subScoreKey.description: The symbol for the sub-score unit.

subScoreName.description: The name of the sub-score unit.

rank.description: The ranking result of the sub-score unit.

totalScore.description: The running total during the sub-score period or unit. Good for split scores.

scoreAttempts.description: The attempts to score during the period (or scoring unit).

basePersonMetadata.description: Metadata that describes a person. | Generally does not change over the course of a sports-events. Extends the baseEntityMetadata type

dateOfBirth.description: The day on which a person was born, normalized to ISO 8601 extended format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+HH:MM. Use YYYY-MM-DD when no time is available. Can also be YYYY-MM or just YYYY if year and/or month not available.

dateOfDeath.description: The day on which a person died, normalized to ISO 8601 extended format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+HH:MM. Use YYYY-MM-DD when no time is available.

height.description: Height of the person. Generally in cm.

weight.description: Weight of a person. Generally in kg.

postitionRegular.description: The code for the typical position of the person.

positionEvent.description: The code for the position held by the person at this  particular sports-event.

positionDepth.description: A ranking amongst players on the team who share the same position.

health.description: An indication of the health of the person

basePlayerStats.description: Statistics that capture how a player has performed. | Generally does change over the course of a sports-event.

timePlayedEvent.description: Value for the amount of time played by this player in a particular sports-event.

timePlayedEventAverage.description: Value for the average amount of time played per-event by the player over the course of a particular time-span, such as a season.

eventsStarted.description: Number of sports-events the player has played in since the start of the event.

basePlayerMetadata.description: Metadata that describes a person. | Generally does not change over the course of a sports-events.

teamIdref.description: A reference to the team for which this player competes.

status.description: Whether a player starts playing at the beginning of a sports-event, joins mid-game, or is not available to participate.

lineupSlot.description: The order in which a player participated in an event.

lineupSlotSequence.description: For baseball, cricket, relay races if they substituted for a player in the original lineup, the order in which they served at the above lineup-slot value. Defaults to 1.

scratchReason.description: An indication as to why this player did not play in an event.

uniformNumber.description: The number currently displayed on the uniform or jersey of the player.

homePageUrl.--comment: in xsd this is defined as type xs:anyURI
homePageUrl.description: The fully-qualified URL for the official home page of the team.

roundPosition.description: The seed or position in this particular round for which this player started. Useful for bracketed tournaments, such as tennis.

baseEntityMetadata.description: Base metadata for different entities. Extended by baseTeamMetadata and basePersonMetadata and siteMetadata

key.description: The symbol or identifying key for the entity.

nationality.description: The country of citizinship of the entity.

baseTeamMetadata.description: Info about the team. Properties of a team that are not based on their competitive performance. | An included sports-content-code element can hold what division it is in, etc.

sportsContentCodes.description: Info about the team. Properties of a team that are not based on their competitive performance. | An included sports-content-code element can hold what division it is in, etc.

alignment.description: Home or visiting. This is more information about the alignment of the team or player in the event regarding rules etc. It does not necessarily indicate that it is the geographical home-site of the team or player.

established.description: Date (and time) when the team was established.

dissolved.description: Date (and time) when the team was dissolved.

teamIdref.description: Optional reference to a team in which this team is a member. Example: The U.S. Davis Cup team consists of many sub-teams.

homePageUrl.description: The fully-qualified URL for the official home page of the team.

roundPosition.description: The seed or position in this particular round for which this team started. Useful for bracketed tournaments, such as tennis.

baseTeamStats.description: Statistics that apply to the team as a whole. | Not all stats are used in every sport.

site.description: An element housing data having to do with a venue, stadium, arena, field, etc.

capacity.description: How many spectators can fill the site.

siteStyle.description: Whether it is an indoor or outdoor site.

surface.description: Describes the surface upon which events are played. For example, in tennis, could be hard-court or grass or clay.

shape.description: A controlled vocabulary for the site's shape. Example for motor-racing: oval.

incline.description: The pitch or embankment of the field of play. Generally in degrees. Example for motor-racing: 13.

length.description: The length of the arena or field of play.

lengthUnits.description: The units used for the length attribute.

type.description: A controlled vocabulary for the type or class of arena. Example for motor-racing: super-speedway.

homePageUrl.description: The website for the venue or arena.

created.description: Date (and time) when a place was built, opened or so.

ceasedToExist.description: Date (and time) when a place ceased to exist.

siteStats.description: Holder for statistics about the site.

alignment.description: Statistics about the site, accurate for a particular occasion. home means the site is home for one of the teams or players. neutral that it is neutral to all participants in the event.

attendance.description: How many spectators attended during the event.

attendanceAverage.description: Average number of spectators that have attended.

temperature.description: Temperature of the event recorded during the competition.

weatherCode.description: A controlled-vocabulary description of the weather, such as sunny, partly-cloudy, etc.

weatherWind.description: Wind reading of the event recorded during the competition.

weatherPrediction.description: Predicted weather conditions for the event.

nCName.description: pattern matches production 4 from the Namespaces in XML spec

truncatedDateTimeType.description: The type of a calendar date with an optional time part which may be truncated from the second part to the month part.

sportsContent.description: Metadata and coverage of sporting news. | Good for scores, schedules, standings, statistics, etc.

baseMetadata.description: Basic metadata objects and attributes. Used directly by sports, standing, schedule and statistics

commonAttributes.description: Common attributes or properties used by various other objects

id.description: An XML-specific identifier for the element.

style.description: An open placeholder for reference by an external stylesheet.

statsCoverage.description: A relative indication of how many statistics are included in the item. SportsML vocab uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spstatscoverage/

teamCoverage.description: Indicates whether the item contains information about one team, or many teams.

durationScope.description: Indicates what class of events the included statistics apply. Example: those events that went into overtime. SportsML vocab uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spdurationscope/

alignmentScope.description: Indicates that the included statistics apply only to events played either at home or away.

position.description: Indicates that the included statistics apply only to while played at a particular position.

recordMakingScope.description: Indicates that the included statistics apply only to values that set a record, such as a team-high, or an individual-low.

scopingLabel.description: A textual description for the scope.

periodValue.description: Used for tracking stats and events by period.

periodType.description: For certain types of periods: overtime, declared (cricket), etc.

startDateTime.description: The starting date, with optional time, of the event for which the stats are relevant.

endDateTime.description: The ending date, with optional time, of the event for which the stats are relevant.

periodStartDateTime.description: The starting date, with optional time, of the period for which the stats are relevant.

periodEndDateTime.description: The ending date, with optional time, of the period for which the stats are relevant.

temporalUnitType.description: The unit of performance to which the stats apply eg. single-event, season, career.

temporalUnitValue.description: The key of performance unit to which the stats apply.

eventSpan.description: Qualifier of "most-recent-events" value for temporal-unit attribute. Specify the number of events eg. 10 for last 10 games.

opponentValue.description: The key of the player, team, division, conference, league or other unit which provide the opposition relevant to the stat.

opponentType.description: Whether the opponent was a player, team, etc.

team.description: The key of the team for which the player or team generated the stats.

competition.description: The key of the league or competition for which the player or team generated the stats.

unitValue.description: The key, other than team or league/competition, of the competitive unit for which the player or team generated the stats.

unitType.description: The type, other than team or league/competition, of the competitive unit for which the player or team generated the stats.

situation.description: Final or current score of the team or player.

locationKey.description: The key of the site,venue or location where the stats were generated.

venueType.description: The type of event (eg. indoor, outdoor, etc.) in which the stats were generated.

surfaceType.description: The type of surface (eg. clay, artificial grass, etc.) upon which the stats were generated.

weatherType.description: A code for the weather situation in which the stats were generated. SportsML weather codes recommended.

scopeValue.description: A generic scope indicator. Use only if none of the other coverage attributes are suitable.

distance.description: Measure of distance for the generated stat.

distanceMaximum.description: Maximum distance for the generated stat.

distanceMinimum.description: Minimum distance for the generated stat.

score.description: Final or current score of the team or player.

scoreOpposing.description: Final or current score of the opposing team or player.

scoreAverage.description: Average per-game score for the team or player.

scoreOpposingAverage.description: Average per-game score for the opposing team or player.

scoreUnits.description: Describes how the score and score-opposing is valued.

scoreBehind.description: The points or time behind the leading score.

scoreAttempts.description: Final or current number of attempts to score by a team or player. Example: in ice hockey, would represent total shots on goal.

scoreAttemptsOpposing.description: Final or current number of attempts to score by an opposing team or player.

scoreAttemptsOnGoal.description: A subset of score-attempts. Only counts those attempts that were on-goal.

scoreAttemptsOnGoalOpposing.description: Final or current number of attempts to score by an opposing team or player that were on-goal.

scorePercentage.description: Percentage of attempted scores that reached their mark.

scorePercentageOpposing.description: Percentage of attempted scores by opposing team or player that reached their mark.

resultEffect.description: Describes the effect that the result of the event or rank changing has had on the team. Example: Whether or not a team has qualified for the playoffs, or has been promoted or demoted to a different division.

eventOutcome.description: Whether the competitor won, lost, or tied. SportsML vocab uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/speventoutcome/

eventStandingPoints.description: How many points were earned as a result of the outcome of this particular event.

eventStandingPointsAgainst.description: How many points were deducted as a result of the outcome of this particular event. This occurs, for example, in the German Handball leagues.

eventsRemaining.description: Number of sports-events the player has yet to participate in.

timeOfPossession.description: Amount of time the team or player has possession of ball (or similar object like puck).

timeOfPossessionPercentage.description: Amount of time the team or player has possession of ball (or similar object like puck) expressed as a percentage of the full time of the match.

timeOfPossessionPercentageOpposing.description: Amount of time the opposing team or player has possession of ball (or similar object like puck) expressed as a percentage of the full time of the match.

timeOfPossessionAverage.description: Amount of time the team or player has possession of ball (or similar object like puck) per game.

timeOfPossessionAverageOpposing.description: Amount of time the opposing team or player has possession of ball (or similar object like puck) per game.

seriesScore.description: Number of events in a series won by team or player.

seriesScoreOpposing.description: Number of events in a series won by opposing team or player.

adjustedScoreFor.description: The final score as adjusted by some authority. Usually as a result of some dispute or transgression that must be settled post-event and rendered in the score. Will differ from the regular score reflecting the number of actual goals scored in play. Should be tested for before displaying actual score.

adjustedScoreAgainst.description: The final score against as adjusted by some authority. Usually as a result of some dispute or transgression that must be settled post-event and rendered in the score. Will differ from the regular score reflecting the number of actual goals scored in play. Should be tested for before displaying actual score.

conceptNameType.description: The type of a natural language name for the concept (Type defined in this XML Schema only)

affiliation.description: A mechanism for assigning the membership of a player, team, or associate within a division or larger organizational structure. Also, to indicate an official's affiliation with a team, club or federation, for example.

membershipIdref.description: A pointer to the ID for the larger organizational structure.

membershipType.description: The type of organizational structure in which this item is a member.

membershipKey.description: A unique key for the organizational structure in which this item is a member.

membershipName.description: The name associated with the organizational structure in which this item is a member.

sportsMetadataProperties.description: Metadata for the document being published. | Holds metadata applying to the document as a whole.

docId.description: The often-unique ID of the document, tracked by publishers.

language.description: The default language of the document.

slug.description: A keyword used by editors to refer to the document.

documentClass.description: A category code for the fixture-key. Recommended categories are news (non-event-specific news reports for player, team, league, etc.), standings (or tables), schedules, statistics (for non-event-specific statistical reports), event-summary (for event-specific reports whether prose (i.e. previews and reviews) or statistical (i.e. boxscores)), event-action (for play actions within a single event), dynamic-resource-file (for team rosters (squad lists), athlete lists, league groupings and teams, etc.)

fixtureKey.description: A consistent key for the type of regularly-published document being transmitted.

catalog.description: A reference to the document listing externally-supplied controlled vocabularies.

sportsTitle.description: A short textual description of the document. | Can show up in search results.

advisory.description: A short textual message to editors receiving the document. | Not generally published through to end-users.

featureName.description: A displayable name for the resource identified by the fixture-key.

sportsContentCodes.description: A set of sport content codes.

sportsContentCode.description: An individual code that describes an entity one may want to filter for. | Describes what sports, what teams, etc., are covered.

codeType.description: What type of item is being described.

codeKey.description: The symbol for the identified content.

codeSource.description: The maintainer of the controlled vocabulary for the code.

codeName.description: A displayable name for the code.

formalName.description: The code or key for the property.

vocabulary.description: Provides a pointer to a Topic Set which is the controlled vocabulary that can be used to resolve the meaning of the formal-name.

scheme.description: Distinguishes which of possibly multiple naming schemes in the controlled vocabulary is the one that governs this formal-name.

value.description: The value of the property. For example, if formal-name equals favorite-color, then value might equal blue.

allowedValues.description: Points to a controlled vocabulary that delimits the set of allowed values for the property.

sportsEvent.description: A sporting competition. | A contest that generally ends with a winner.

eventMetadata.description: Background information about an event. | Where, when, and what an event is.

eventSponsors.description: A displayable name for the event-recurring-key.

eventRecurringName.description: A displayable name for the event-recurring-key.

eventRecurringKey.description: The symbol for an identified sports-event that recurs every season. This same key should be used from season to season.

eventStyle.description: Indicates whether competitors are trying to defeat each other or just outdo one another.

eventNumber.description: The ranked position this event had among other events.

eventStatus.description: The stage of the event, describing whether it has started, is in progress, etc.

eventStatusReason.description: The reason for the event status. Eg. why the cancellation, postponement, etc. CHECK!!

eventStatusNote.description: A textual description of the reason or context of the event-status or event-status-reason value.

eventOfDay.description: If the day had multiple events involving these competitors, which event of the day it was. Example values: 1, 2, 3, etc.

eventsDayTotal.description: How many events involving these competitors have been planned for that day.

startWeekday.description: Day of the week in which the game starts.

endWeekday.description: Day of the week in which the game ends.

heatNumber.description: The ranked position this heat had among other heats.

duration.description: The length of time the event took place.

seasonKey.description: The season this event is in.

seriesIndex.description: The tournament division or series to which an event belongs.

eventOutcomeType.description: What type of outcome. Includes overtime, random (eg. by coin toss), etc.

eventStats.description: Stats applying to the game as a whole. Initially designed for motor-racing, but potentially applicable to many sports.

team.description: A team participating in a sporting event. | Holds metadata and statistical data for team.

player.description: A competitor. | Their athletic talents help them decide who wins a sports-event.

playerMetadata.description: Metadata that describes a person. | Generally does not change over the course of a sports-events.

wageringStats.description: An object to house lines and odds for wagering. | Includes moneylines, spreads, etc.

associate.description: Metadata that describes an associate | Generally does not change over the course of a sports-events

actions.description: Complex type for sports events, both generic and sport specific.

highlight.description: A textual highlight. | Can hold plain text, or could hold NITF.

award.description: A medal, ribbon, placement, or other type of award. | Can be assigned to an event, a team, or a player.

tournament.description: A structured series of competitions within one sport. | Generally organized by a particular sponsoring body. Can happen all in one day, or be spread out - like the Davis Cup in tennis.

schedule.description: A series of games. | Usually grouped by date.

standing.description: Also known as a (league) table | A ranked, comparative list of team or individual records.

statistic.description: A table that generally compares the performance of teams or players. | The fixture-key can identify which regulary-running statistics are being presented. Also appropriate for rosters (squad listings).
